fields.summary: When creating a Group/Role to a Principal in the Demo application, an exception is thrown.

fields.description: Add's fail to persist the description field, but performing an update works just fine.
fields.summary: When adding a Group or Role via the Demo app, the description field is not being persisted.
Allow navigation by url mangling

fields.description:
Receiving error when trying to run Crowd's build script:

BUILD FAILED
/usr/local/crowd/crowd-1.2.2/build.xml:2: taskdef class com.oopsconsultancy.xmltask.ant.XmlTask cannot be found
fields.summary: Receiving error when trying to build Crowd 1.2.2: taskdef class com.oopsconsultancy.xmltask.ant.XmlTask cannot be found

fields.description:
There is absolutely no way that the client/lib needs all of those 46 JAR files, I think it is time we had a massive trim of our release.

Some possibly targets, replace xfire-all with xfire-core+xfire-spring * and use xbeans and not jaxb2.

There is no way we need mail, opensaml, jmock + others.
fields.summary: Have you seen the client/lib directory lately? The current count is about 46 JAR files!

fields.description: Auto-focus first field in console to make keyboard use of console much easier.
fields.summary: Auto-Focus first field in web console

fields.description: Need to test Crowd WAR deployment with JIRA and Confluence.  Users have reported JAR conflicts.
fields.summary: Test WAR deployment in Tomcat for JAR incompatibilities with JIRA and Confluence

fields.description: This will allow for easier upgrading of Crowd. The crowd.properties should reside in an external Crowd home directory.
fields.summary: Move crowd.properties outside the crowd-web-app

fields.description:
Some textual improvements for the new Directory Importer.

*Options tab:*
* Heading: 'What directory do you want to migrate your users from? And where do you want them to go?' > 'Which directory do you want to copy your users from? And where do you want them to go?' 
* Label: 'Target Directory' > 'Destination Directory'
* Label: 'Overwrite Target Directory' > 'Overwrite Destination Directory' 
* Text: 'Setting this option will override any groups and users found in the Target Directory.' > 'Tick this box to delete and replace all details and memberships for already-existing users in the destination directory.

*Confirmation tab:*
* 'Importing users & groups too:' > 'Importing users & groups to:'
* 'Overwrite Target Directory' > 'Overwrite Destination Directory' 

*Select Import Type tab:*
* 'Import your Users, Groups & Roles from another Directory within Crowd' > 'Import your users, groups and roles from another directory defined in Crowd.'
(Note capitalisation and full stop too.)

Please check any other messages etc for the word 'target'.

(i) The docs assume the wording will be 'destination directory' rather than 'target directory'.
fields.summary: Textual changes on new directory importer screens

fields.description:
The Internal Directory does not support RFC-2798 for the 'name' attribute in LDAP, a name can be a group name or a user name.

Searching, Authentication requests, any CRUD (create, retrieve, update, delete) operation should be case insensitive on the name field.

For example a user the the user name: JamesD is the same as jamesd, or jamesD etc.

There should be only one record for this user in the Internal Directory.
fields.summary: Support case-insensitivity for the Internal Directory, this is in the aim of providing support for RFC-2798

fields.description:
The prefixes on the files states:
#!/bin/sh

This is fine, except that the files are ACTUALLY using bash syntax.

You have no doubt had this work because on Linux-based systems, /bin/sh is actually running bash. However, on other systems (namely Solaris x86) /bin/sh is old-skool shell (specifically ksh), and not bash.

I recommend that you change the prefixes to these to be
#!/bin/bash
When I did this, they started running more successfully.
fields.summary: build.sh and start_crowd.sh incorrectly refer to a particular shell
Sun OpenDS is not supported

fields.description: Although almost all directory servers provide this information, we should not assume it is provided. We should provide better error and UI handling when these attributes do not exist or are NULL.
fields.summary: OpenID Server assumes directory implementation provides First Name, Last Name, Email

fields.description:
As of Crowd 1.2, the support for using subversion authorization files to control access on a per directory basis doesn't work if the {{SVNParentPath}} directive is used in the apache config file. This is a known limitation.

{{SVNParentPath}} allows you to put multiple svn repositories in a directory and access them through a single URL (see http://svnbook.red-bean.com/nightly/en/svn.serverconfig.pathbasedauthz.html and http://svnbook.red-bean.com/nightly/en/svn.ref.mod_dav_svn.conf.html).

If you _do_ have multiple repositories you can make it work by defining apache {{<Location>}} blocks for each one and using a separate authz file for each, but it's a bit more work to set up and maintain.

Example:
{noformat}
<Location /svn/tools1>
DAV svn
SVNPath /usr/local/svnrepos/tools1
...
</Location>

<Location /svn/tools2>
DAV svn
SVNPath /usr/local/svnrepos/tools2
...
</Location>

<Location /svn/tools3>
DAV svn
SVNPath /usr/local/svnrepos/tools3
...
</Location>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Apache module's Subversion support should support the SVNParentPath directive

fields.description: Add the ability to modify logging levels and enable profiling (like JIRA and Confluence) via the Admin screen in Crowd.
fields.summary: Add Logging & Profiling functionality into Crowd Admin screen.

fields.description:
In my organisation many of the java web apps use acegi (spring security) filters to detect if a user has logged on. If users have not logged on they are redirected to a central CAS logon page which transparently logs them on with their windows domain credentials (if they are using IE, if firefox, they manually type in their details). Then they are redirected back to the page they came from.

This works well because individual web apps dont have to worry about the logon mechanism, or writing logon pages with NTLM HTTP authentication.

Could crowd provide a facility like this? The web page (assuming IE) should log users in automatically, and redirect them to the application url they came from. If they logged in successfully, crowd would then issue a cookie - allowing all apps participating in sso to be logged in.
fields.summary: Central sign-on page with NTLM HTTP authentication for web applications

fields.description: Due to JIRA's use of OSUser framework for user management, all users, groups and memberships are requested during common actions like Add Project.  If Crowd integration is using a large directory, this can cause serious degradation in JIRA performance.  The Crowd client libraries may not be caching this data effectively to help rectify this problem.
fields.summary: Crowd client libraries and caching need further review to improve JIRA performance

fields.description: Requested by David Soul at a Crowd Q&A session: Add some high-level information, for non-tech users, on the skillset etc required to develop custom connectors.
fields.summary: Add high-level overview of skills etc reqd to write custom connectors

fields.description: It will be good to have an authenticator to register all authenticated users to certain groups/roles. A similar authenticator to _ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator_ would be ideal.
fields.summary: Automated adding of users to groups/roles

fields.description:
Improve this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Creating+a+Custom+Directory+Connector

Requested by Jonathan Nolen in Team Lead meeting, in connection with CodeGeist. Also requested by David Soul in person.
fields.summary: Improve documentation for creating a custom directory connector

fields.description:
Both {{PrincipalDAOHibernate.add()}} (line 39) and {{GroupDAOHibernate.add()}} (line 39) call {{HibernateTemplate.clear()}} which closes the Hibernate Session.

Extending InternalDirectory to do multiple CRUD transactions fails after doing an add() because the Session is closed. Is the clear() necessary? Shouldn't the flush() do all a clear() does without closing the Sesison?

Our development requires us to comment out the clear() and recompile Crowd. It would be nice if add() could accommodate us (by leaving the Session open) and the import routines (which I'm told is why the clear() is there to begin with).
fields.summary: Hibernate DAOs for Principals and Groups close the Hibernate Session when adding

fields.description:
The idea is to modularise Crowd much further than it currently is and remove the poor dependency on crowd-core for our clients.

The end result should be an 'uber jar' that contains all maven modules that have to do with client integration, eg:

# crowd-intregration-osuser
# crowd-intregration-atlassian-user
# crowd-intregration-seraph
# crowd-intregration-fisheye
# crowd-intregration-acegi
# crowd-intregration-jive

And be combined into a single jar file: crowd-integration-client-1.3.jar
fields.summary: Crowd's Client libraries should be slimmed down to a single JAR file containing all required classes for a Crowd Client

fields.description:
The use case for having the openid-server as an external client application was so that multiple openid-servers could be run against a single Crowd server.

This fringe use-case benefit pales in comparison to the other benefits of having the openid-server built-in to the crowd-console:
- easier configuration (administration can be done via a single console)
- easier backups (1 database, not 2)
- cleaner code (no need to push things to crowd-core to make them available to openid-server)

This will require role permissioning within the Crowd application (ie. crowd-users, crowd-administrators, possibly crowd-openid-users, etc).
fields.summary: Bring the openid-server application in to the crowd-console application

fields.description:
When trying to use the build.bat I got an errormessage that build.bat was failing with error "xmltask....etc".
This happen due to a missing xmltask-......jar file in the tools\ant\lib directory.
I downloaded xmltask-v1.15.1.jar from oopsconsultancy website, changed the classpath in the build.bat and everything worked  as it should.
If the file isn´t part of the release I think you should inform in your installation instructions that this file have to be downloaded manually.

Regards

//Bengt
fields.summary: File missing in 1.2.2 release

fields.summary: not able to connect to sunone directory server when crowd war running on jboss

fields.description: Replicated with user's configuration using Co-pilot.   JIRA was running on the same machine as Confluence and Crowd (all standalone).  Increased crowd-ecache.xml to hold 500000 objects in memory and gave 14400 seconds to idle and live.  Initial login for all users takes approximately 15 seconds or greater.  User Browser is initially slow but, once cached, seems to work.  Caching for the JIRA application may not be behaving as expected.   Confluence had no problems using the SSL enabled Active Directory via Crowd.
fields.summary: Crowd client libraries for JIRA using AD with SSL enabled are unacceptably slow.

fields.description: Update existing Crowd admin UI to improve user experience.
fields.summary: Revamp Crowd Admin UI

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 27 April 2011|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi folks,
Kerberos is preferred to NTLMv2 as a method of authentication. Where NTLM is required, third party plugins have been made available on plugins.atlassian.com that enable Kerberos and NTLM, and can be found here and here. These solutions are in use by many of our customers and are working well. NTLMv2 support not be in the long term roadmap for Crowd, and we're spending our time and effort improving Crowd to be more scalable, reliable and fast! 

We've decided to close this issue because we feel that by leaving it open, there's undue expectation that the issue is being actively worked on, and we don't want to give you the wrong information.

Regards,
Eugene Mak
Atlassian Product Management

{panel}

Many customer ask to be able to use their windows logins for confluence or jira. This would be a wonderful addition.
fields.summary: Does Crowd support NTLM v2 for Vista

fields.description:
Since this is an open feature request

   http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-583, 

we should probably note that you cannot add attributes to LDAP connectors in this doc:

   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/4.06+Specifying+a+Principal%27s+Attributes
fields.summary: Update Crowd doc for principal attributes to let customers know this will not update LDAP attributes for a principal.

fields.description:
We've had a number of support issues with this error in the logs:

ERROR org.hibernate.event.def.AbstractFlushingEventListener: Could not synchronize database state with session
org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1

The Crowd method which causes this error varies.  I will link related support issues for dev review.
fields.summary: Hibernate StaleStateExceptions in Crowd

fields.description:
Sarah, can you assign this issue to me? I want to tie this documentation update to Crowd 1.3, but I can do the actual update.

Need to update the following page, when Crowd includes delegated LDAP auth (due Crowd 1.3):
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/5.13.2+Integrating+Bamboo+with+LDAP

Specifically, the table in the 'External User Management Configuration' section needs to cover this new option.
fields.summary: Crowd with delegated LDAP auth - update documentation for Bamboo-Crowd integration

fields.description:
Confluence and JIRA allow Mail Server configurations through a JNDI location of a javax.mail.Session object to use.
I think that you should consider this option for Crowd as well.

Also, in Confluence and JIRA this is the only way to use TLS for the SMTP server connections; this does not seem to be possible in Crowd at all.
fields.summary: Allow Mail Server configuration through JNDI location (+TLS for connections)

fields.description: Since this can cause problems during restore (such as date and number formatting), it may be helpful to store the locale of the JVM from the machine on which the backup was performed as a value in the XML backup.  Restore could then check to see if this locale matches the current machine.  If not, toss up an error warning the user that this restore will not be possible using this locale.
fields.summary: XML Backup using one locale cannot be restored to another machine using a different locale.
Error removing groups on the Admin Console's View Group screen

fields.description:
Each {{RemoteDirectory}} interface implementation call loads a new {{RemoteDirectory}} object, resulting in a very expensive and inefficient way of performing calls.

The {{DirectoryInstanceLoader}} should maintain a single instance of each {{RemoteDirectory}} implementation per directory.
fields.summary: DirectoryInstanceLoader should only have one directory instance of each directory in memory rather than multiple reloads by the managers

fields.description:
This one is pretty scary.  I was playing around with a new crowd user to see if they could change their password, so I created a new user that is a part of no groups in firefox, then logged in with that user in Safari to get a known different session. 

What I got surprised me.  I would have hoped for an abbreviated site that only let me change my password (since the new user was not a part of crowd-administrators), but I kind of expected that it just wasn't going to let me log in at all.  Instead, I logged in just fine to the crowd admin console.  Curious how this might look for other credentialed users from my org that were not in the crowd-administrator group, I started snooping around.  All reports worked.  And it turns out, the completely uncredentialed user could change anything!

Am I missing something?
fields.summary: Any authenticated user can change any other user?!?

fields.description:
Looking at is happening per request just logging into the console:
{noformat}
13:32:50,312 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@248eac[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,346 DEBUG atlassian.crowd.model.principal.PrincipalDAOHibernate: Updating Principal: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal@2b8387[ID=-1,name=admin,directoryID=32769,active=true,conception=2007-11-16 14:33:12.0,lastModified=2008-01-10 15:36:54.086]
13:32:50,357 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal@2b8387[ID=-1,name=admin,directoryID=32769,active=true,conception=2007-11-16 14:33:12.0,lastModified=2008-01-10 15:36:54.086]
13:32:50,360 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Saved object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@e7a58[ID=458760,key=JV6VdrieGn7YMCSM3UmgzA00,name=admin,Directory ID=32769]
13:32:50,387 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@532f9e[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,413 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@7fb0c2[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,423 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@faa96d[ID=458760,key=JV6VdrieGn7YMCSM3UmgzA00,name=admin,Directory ID=32769]
13:32:50,440 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@3455e7[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,461 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@4f8f8b[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,467 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@231a02[ID=458760,key=JV6VdrieGn7YMCSM3UmgzA00,name=admin,Directory ID=32769]
13:32:50,477 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Updated object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.token.Token@a13ea6[ID=229377,key=NYQgL3MvYCT0jz7b6NYQFA00,name=crowd,Directory ID=-1]
13:32:50,482 DEBUG crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao: Loaded object: com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.Directory@3d569[ID=32769,name=Test Internal Directory,directoryID=0,active=true,conception=2007-11-16 14:33:11.0,lastModified=2007-11-16 14:33:13.0]
{noformat}

The application token is being updated *6* times and the user token is being updated *3* times.

In a perfect world this should really be once per request.

Could we look at some kind of filter, AOP etc, so this is only happening once per client request?

This could also be a case of being overzealous in our use of isAuthenticated() in the Crowd Console, since I feel we can assume that we are because of the VerifyTokenFilter, so any other calls to isAuthenticated are just noise.
fields.summary: Optimise database access per request, e.g. Token access.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 October 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,
 
Thank you for your votes and comments on this feature request. Whilst this is something we would like to implement some day, it is not planned to be a part of a forthcoming release.
 
We will be focussing on improving the integration of Crowd within our Atlassian suite of products, as well as simplifying and improving the overall user management and a unified administrative experience.
 
If our release plan changes and this feature request becomes a priority, this ticket will be updated. If you'd like to better understand how we make roadmap decisions, have a read of : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Implementation+of+New+Features+Policy
 
Cheers, Helen Hung
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

I would like to move users from one directory to another one. The target scenario in our case would be creating an archive directory that contains users that are not longer required (and should not only be inactive).
fields.summary: Moving users between directories

fields.description:
Procedure:
CREATE DATABASE crowd CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci;
CREATE USER 'crowduser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'samuelphang';
do the thing which grants all rights to crowduser from localhost to crowd

mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar in
/home/samuel/hfh/crowd-1.2.1/apache-tomcat-5.5.20/common/lib

/home/samuel/hfh/crowd-1.2.1/apache-tomcat-5.5.20/conf/Catalina/localhost
crowd.xml
delete
              driverClassName="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver"
              url="jdbc:hsqldb:${catalina.home}/../database/crowddb"
              minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="4000"
              timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="5000"
              maxActive="20"
paste
going with & for & because xml parsers only understand &
    <Resource name="jdbc/CrowdDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
              username="crowduser"
              password="samuelphang"
              driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
              url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/crowd?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8"
            />

/home/samuel/hfh/crowd-1.2.1
build.properties
detele
hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.HSQLDialect
paste
hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLInnoDBDialect

enter crowd setup on http://localhost:8095/

etc etc etc

Username: samuel
Password: phang

Invalid login.

Roll back, using latin1 instead of unicode.

delete crowd database and crowduser from mysql

CREATE DATABASE crowd;
CREATE USER 'crowduser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'samuelphang';

Crowd setup.

Username: samuel
Password: phang

Invalid login.

Still doesn't work. I think there was an xml file that I didn't change, the one with problem parsing &.

lets use
characterEncoding=latin1
so this
url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/crowd?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8"
changes to this
url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/crowd?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=latin1"

Still doesn't work.

lets try
fresh unzipped crowd-1.2.1
url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/crowd?autoReconnect=true"
hibernate.dialect=org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLInnoDBDialect
CREATE DATABASE crowd;

Invalid login.
fields.summary: Unable to logon to Crowd after admin setup, various characterEncodings used, using MySQL database.
Logging output should be more specific

fields.description:
Hi there,

I just tried the backup function on 1.2.1 and almost had a heart attack!  The reason was I just got done backing up a different Crowd (1.0.7) server in production and didn't remember unchecking "reset domain".... and as I discovered this new feature, realized I might have pooched the other server!  

Anyway, I just wanted to check that you had a nice warning if the user doesn't know what that option is before it wipes the DB clean (I need to save my data so I'm not going to try it right away :-)

Thanks
fields.summary: "Reset Domain" checkbox defaulting to checked is aggressive

fields.description:
I have the internal directory set up with a good set of users and credentials that I would like to migrate to LDAP.  Understanding that this may not always work if schema checking were to deny inserts based on missing attributes in the target schema, this would be an *extremely* useful feature to have. 

Another way to do this would be to allow "import" to import from another directory.  In my current use case, that would actually be desirable, since I want all of the users, but that's probably not the common case.

Congrats on the 1.2.1 release, it's really looking great!
fields.summary: Allow live migration of users across directories

fields.description: Non-thread-safe initialisation of CacheManagerImpl means that multiple instances of the cache may be created on the client. Wasteful in terms of network traffic & database load.
fields.summary: Concurrency Issue in client libraries may result in multiple caches

fields.description: Allow lo4j configuring of XFire requests between the client applications and the Crowd server.
fields.summary: Allow configuring of request logs in the Crowd client libraries.

fields.description: This isn't as bad as it sounds since the outer calling classes are, this is just a little weird.
fields.summary: The Application Manager and PropertyManager are not being wrapped in a transaction.

fields.description:
Would be useful to be able to record / display in Sessions the IP address of authenticating users.
Particularly desirable from an audit / Sarbanes Oxley perspective.
fields.summary: Record IP address of authenticating users

fields.description:
Currently groups contain a collection of users. Going forward, users will contain a collection of groups. However to maintain backwards compatibility, groups still can refer to a lazy loaded collection of users.

In order to allow for cleaner optimisation in both internal and LDAP directories, the concept of memberships should be separate from Groups and Principals.

This refactor is likely to affect a large portion of the backend code.
fields.summary: Separate the concept of users, groups and memberships
Spaces after session.validationinterval in crowd.properties causes a NumberFormatException

fields.description:
Currently it isn't possible to get much information about the different crowd clients from within the crowd server.

If there was a very simple mechanism for crowd clients to pass the properties to the server (which just keeps them in memory), you could have a page that shows the properties for each client.

This would also be great when looking at how many connections are made from each client to the server.
fields.summary: Crowd client should pass version, configuration information to server

fields.description:
Steps to replicate this issue.

# Create a user
# View this user and remove their email address
# Click update
# You will see an exception in the logs and also note that there are zero attributes for the principal
fields.summary: OGNL Exception being thrown when updating a principal

fields.description: Allow users to diagnose load problems more easily by showing graphs / running totals of the number of requests made, ordered by application and/or type.
fields.summary: Add summary page showing running totals of requests by application

fields.description: In the past, HTTP logging was turned off due to disk space worries. Since it's useful for debugging problems, turn it on by default.
fields.summary: Turn on HTTP logging by default

fields.description:
The following exception is being seen in extranet Crowd:

{noformat}
17:00:38,684 ERROR org.codehaus.xfire.handler.DefaultFaultHandler: Fault occurred!
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(ArrayList.java:547)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:322)

	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.directory.internal.InternalDirectory.requiresPasswordChange(InternalDirectory.java:797)

	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.directory.internal.InternalDirectory.authenticate(InternalDirectory.java:184)

We need to replace the current calls to AttributeValues with the singleValue calls.

Poor logging of a Token miss in the In-memory token cache.

fields.description:
We need to up the version of wstx-asl to the latest 3.2.3 version to fix a Java 1.4 vs 1.5 incompatibility.

The related WSTX issue: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/WSTX-110
fields.summary: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can't overwrite cause exception seen in Crowd

fields.description:
This is a feature which is on interface (ie. SearchContext allows it) but has not been implemented in the backend DAOs.

Although there are work arounds to this, it would be good to actually implement the searching.
fields.summary: Searching groups/roles via members does not work
Configuration classs for the LDAP importer

fields.description:
The concept is to create an importer that moves Users, Groups and Memberships from an LDAP directory to an internal directory (or any other directory).

This is being done to help with the delegated authentication directory we are creating so users can easily migrate to it without creating all the users/groups/memberships themselves.
fields.summary: LDAP Importer, to migrate data from one directory into another.

fields.description:
Use Hibernate's second-level cache - it was designed for things like this.

Currently we use a manual cache manager.
fields.summary: Remove manual caching of Server Properties

fields.description: Place link to the "import from XML" feature in the setup process.
fields.summary: Enable import from XML in the setup process

fields.description:
Large Crowd backups are slow to import/export. It would be good to go over the import/export code to ensure that we are reading and writing the backups in the most efficient manner.

In particular, we should update our import process to adhere to the dom4j guidlines: http://www.dom4j.org/faq.html#large-doc
fields.summary: Faster XML import/export for large backups

fields.description:
For example, in JIRA, we would like to include Crowd runtime information on our System Information page, to make diagnosing some support cases easier.

Currently, the best we can do to determine if Crowd is being used is:
* obtain an instance of a CredentialsProvider
* check that the class name contains "Crowd" (to indicate a Crowd implementation)

Some extra information would useful, such as:
* current version
* ...?
fields.summary: Provide a way to obtain Crowd Information from applications

fields.description: When performing the 1.2.1 release with Sam leB, we found that the mvn release:perform task didn't deploy the artifact.
fields.summary: When 1.2.1 was being released mvn release:perform didn't deploy the artifact

fields.description:
Error when attempting to remove a group, after accessing the 'View Group' --> 'Principals' tab.

See attached screenshot.

Note: This error only happens when you first view the 'View Group' --> 'Principals' tab then attempt to remove the group.

To reproduce the error:
# Go to the Group Browser.
# Select a directory and search for groups.
# Select a group. The 'View Group' screen appears.
# Click the 'Principals' tab.
# Click 'Remove Group'.
# Error 'Failed to find com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemoteGroup DirectoryID: 458753 and name: null'. Group name has disappeared. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Error when attempting to remove a group

fields.description:
We instruct customers to add a dependency to the pom.xml but do not  instruct the customer to add an Atlassian repository in order to grab the correct Crowd Acegi integration jar.

     http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+AppFuse+-+a+Crowd-Acegi+Integration+Tutorial
fields.summary: Acegi docs need repository info.

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem:
# Go to Home page of Administration Console.
# Click 'Change Password' at top right. The 'Change Your Password' screen appears.
# Click the 'Cancel' button.
# Error appears:
{code}
HTTP Status 404 - /crowd/secure/console.action

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*type* Status report

*message* /crowd/secure/console.action

*description* The requested resource (/crowd/secure/console.action) is not available.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Apache Tomcat/5.5.20
{code}

Note that the error does not appear if you just click the 'Home' link instead of the 'Cancel' button.
fields.summary: Clicking cancel on change-password screen causes error

fields.description: Test Description
fields.summary: 1st Bug

fields.description:
Crowd WAR deployment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/2.3+Installing+Crowd+and+CrowdID+WAR+Distribution

Document the step-by-step deployment for each supported application server. 

Currently, we do a generic guide plus a JBoss example
fields.summary: Document the WAR deployment steps for each supported application server

fields.description:
The HTTPAuthenticator before it sees if it should attempt an authentication request with crowd (via the session.lastvalidation property), should check to see that a valid Crowd Cookie exists for a given request.

If no valid token is found in the request, assume the request is not authenticated.
fields.summary: The HTTPAuthenticator isAuthenticated method should initially check for a token

fields.description: A number of vulnerabilities have been reported in Tomcat. Update our packaged instance to the patched version.
fields.summary: Update Tomcat to 5.5.25 to fix reported vulns

fields.description: We recently upgraded to Crowd 1.1.2, Confluence 2.6 and JIRA 3.10.2.  We now have to sign into each of the applications individually.  Not sure why the single sign on no longer works.
fields.summary: Single sign-on not working

fields.description:
1.  Under the Group tab, I would like to be able to see all users assigned to a group and be able to delete users from this view.

2.  Under the Role tab, I would like to be able to see all users assigned to a role and be able to delete users from this view.

Currently, I need to view each user to see what group or role assigned to them and if you have lots of users, this take some time to do.
fields.summary: See all users under a group or role

fields.description:
Our exsisting jira instance is integrated with crowd,and all the user details are maintained in crowd itslef . Now we are upgrade crowd with LDAP Active Directory . For this we created test instance .

1. Windows2003 server with Active Directory 
2 . Crowd 1.2...

	All setup is done and started the crowd server. 

Configured LDAP Active Directories Details are :

Connector Tab Information :

	URL = "LDAP Service URL"
	Secure SSL = not selected 
	Base DN = dc='domain name',dc=com
	User DN = CN='username',CN=Users,dc='domainname',dc=com
	Password = 'XXXXXXX'

I clicked Test Connection the Warining message as
	"The server address and port are valid. Please verify your DN settings through the Configuration panel by performing a group, role, or principal search."

Next I clicked Continue Button the exception as
	"Operation failed; nested exception is javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s); remaining name 'dc=domainssil,dc=com'; nested exception is: org.springframework.ldap.UncategorizedLdapException: Operation failed; nested exception is javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s); remaining name 'dc=domainssil,dc=com'"
	
Same as Configuration Tab ,

	What information i will give to all this text box ? :
	
	Group Object Class , Group Object Filter ,Group Name Attribute , Group Desciption Attribute , Group Members Attribute
fields.summary: Crowd With LDAP Active Directory Connector
Fix logging on startup for the OpenID Server. Stop the logging of Hibernate INFO.

fields.description: The label on the Config Test page is "Update >>", rather than something that makes more sense, as we're only checking if the user's credentials work, not making any changes
fields.summary: Button label in console | Application | Config Test says "Update >>" instead of "Check" or "Validate"

fields.description: While trying to install the Crowd OpenID webapp from the war download, I ran into a "ClassNotFoundError". The cause turned out to be a missing commons-logging jar file. I solved the issue by copying the commons-logging-1.0.4.jar from the Crowd webapp.
fields.summary: Crowd OpenID WAR file is missing commons-logging jar.

fields.description:
While trying to install Crowd from the WAR files supplied on the download page, I ran into a "ClassNotFoundException" while trying to deploy on Tomcat (6.0.14). The cause turned out to be a missing JTA dependency (the needed jta-1.0.1B.jar is supplied with the stand-alone download) that needed to be placed in the shared lib folder (/lib on Tomcat 6, /common/lib on Tomcat 5).

It would be nice if such dependencies were mentioned in the documentation. It would be even nicer if specific instructions for a couple of common application servers were included (similar to the current instructions for JBoss).
fields.summary: Installation from WAR documentation needs to mention additional dependencies
Need to ensure that special characters are escaped properly  for UTF-8 in XML backup.

fields.description:
A group containing 20,000 users will take some time (3 seconds) to determine if a user is a member of the group.

The probable cause is in the underlying implementation, which performs a "contains" operation on the members collection of a group. In effect, this loads up all the members of a group.

The likely fix will be to replace the Java/memory "contains" with a SQL lookup.

This bug also applies to roles.
fields.summary: The isMember call for groups can be slow for very large groups in an Internal Directory

fields.description:
If you have:

1- A Crowd version _prior_ to 1.2.2
2- You have Single Sign-On (SSO) activated.
3- JIRA and Confluence with Trusted Application support, and
3- You are not seeing any results when using macros that pull data from the other system (for example, the jiraissues macro).

Then you are most likely affected by this bug. Update to Crowd 1.2.2 to fix the problem.
fields.summary: Crowd SSO is incompatible with JIRA 3.12/Confluence 2.7 trusted application feature.

fields.description:
Seeing fun stuff like this in the logs:

{code}
22:08:02,222 ERROR org.codehaus.xfire.handler.DefaultFaultHandler: Fault occurred!
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not delete: [com.atlassian.crowd.integration.model.RemotePrincipal#component[directoryID,name]{directoryID=65537, name=novygees}]; SQL [delete from `REMOTEPRINCIPAL` where `DIRECTORYID`=? and `NAME`=?]; Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`crowddb/REMOTEGROUPMEMBERS`, CONSTRAINT `FKF8D0F100F19C38AE` FOREIGN KEY (`REMOTEPRINCIPALDIRECTORYID`, `REMOTEPRINCIPALNAME`) REFERENCES `REMOTEPRINCIPAL` (`DIRECTORYID`, `NAME`)); nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`crowddb/REMOTEGROUPMEMBERS`, CONSTRAINT `FKF8D0F100F19C38AE` FOREIGN KEY (`REMOTEPRINCIPALDIRECTORYID`, `REMOTEPRINCIPALNAME`) REFERENCES `REMOTEPRINCIPAL` (`DIRECTORYID`, `NAME`))
java.sql.SQLException: Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`crowddb/REMOTEGROUPMEMBERS`, CONSTRAINT `FKF8D0F100F19C38AE` FOREIGN KEY (`REMOTEPRINCIPALDIRECTORYID`, `REMOTEPRINCIPALNAME`) REFERENCES `REMOTEPRINCIPAL` (`DIRECTORYID`, `NAME`))
{code}

This may be a result of using MySQLInnoDB as mentioned in the [MySQL docs|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/update.html]:


_If you use a multiple-table UPDATE statement involving InnoDB tables for which there are foreign key constraints, the MySQL optimizer might process tables in an order that differs from that of their parent/child relationship. In this case, the statement fails and rolls back. Instead, update a single table and rely on the ON UPDATE capabilities that InnoDB  provides to cause the other tables to be modified accordingly. See Section 12.2.6.4, "FOREIGN KEY Constraints"_

_Currently, you cannot update a table and select from the same table in a subquery._

{code}
10:03:49,351 ERROR org.hibernate.event.def.AbstractFlushingEventListener: Could not synchronize database state with session
org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1
at org.hibernate.jdbc.Expectations$BasicExpectation.checkBatched(Expectations.java:61)
at org.hibernate.jdbc.Expectations$BasicExpectation.verifyOutcome(Expectations.java:46)
at org.hibernate.jdbc.NonBatchingBatcher.addToBatch(NonBatchingBatcher.java:24)
at org.hibernate.persister.entity.AbstractEntityPersister.delete(AbstractEntityPersister.java:2520)
at org.hibernate.persister.entity.AbstractEntityPersister.delete(AbstractEntityPersister.java:2697)
at org.hibernate.action.EntityDeleteAction.execute(EntityDeleteAction.java:74)
at org.hibernate.engine.ActionQueue.execute(ActionQueue.java:250)
at org.hibernate.engine.ActionQueue.executeActions(ActionQueue.java:234)
at org.hibernate.engine.ActionQueue.executeActions(ActionQueue.java:146)
at org.hibernate.event.def.AbstractFlushingEventListener.performExecutions(AbstractFlushingEventListener.java:298)
at org.hibernate.event.def.DefaultFlushEventListener.onFlush(DefaultFlushEventListener.java:27)
at org.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.flush(SessionImpl.java:1000)
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.HibernateTemplate$27.doInHibernate(HibernateTemplate.java:811)
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:372)
at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.HibernateTemplate.flush(HibernateTemplate.java:809)
at com.atlassian.crowd.util.persistence.hibernate.HibernateDao.remove(HibernateDao.java:53)
at com.atlassian.crowd.model.principal.PrincipalDAOHibernate.remove(PrincipalDAOHibernate.java:200)
at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.directory.internal.InternalDirectory.removePrincipal(InternalDirectory.java:659)
at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.removePrincipal(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:726)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor377.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.refl
{code}
fields.summary: Session gets out of synch with db in method removePrincipal in ServerSecurityClient

fields.description: Crowd's Support Request action should replicate JIRA's Support Request action, including ability to add request to existing support issue, add logs and XML backup.

fields.summary: Better user instructions for javax.naming.SizeLimitExceededException

fields.description: I'm using a default of Xms128m and Xmx256m.  See the attached file.
fields.summary: Add setenv.sh file in the apache-tomcat-5.5.20/bin directory for easier memory management.

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to clone an internal directory.  If nothing else it would be useful for testing large updates.
fields.summary: Ability to clone an internal directory
Help links directly in the administration console

fields.description:
The search results should be sorted by alpha before being returned to a soap client.

{quote}
The biggest one is when we are trying to add groups to a Crowd
Application (such as a Confluence connector), the groups are
non-alphabetized. This creates an issue since well over 500 groups are
listed in no specific order making it hard to find the group to be
selected.
{quote}
fields.summary: Sort groups, users and roles before returning results to the security server client

fields.description: This will help provide needed info that might be missing from the initial issue.
fields.summary: Write System Info page to atlassian-crowd.log on Crowd startup

fields.description: It would be helpful to have Crowd let us know what directories are being used with a particular Crowd instance.
fields.summary: Add Crowd Directory Information to the Crowd logs

fields.description:
The Crowd documentation states that applications need to be registered with Crowd.  Once you register an application, you must give Crowd the remote address of the application in the Remote Applications tab.  It appears that only IP addresses can be used here.

Can you please consider allowing hostnames to be used in the Remote Addresses tab?  It is very inconvenient to use IP addresses, because if the application moves, the user has to change the remote address in the Crowd console manually.

I have heard from Atlassian support that IP addresses are used for security reasons, but I hope the option to use hostnames would be offered. 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow Crowd to accept hostnames for Remote Addresses tab for registered applications in administration console

fields.description: Crowd Subversion Integration should report an UNAUTHORIZED error message if password has been changed allowing the svn client to request an updated password
fields.summary: Crowd Subversion Integration should report an UNAUTHORIZED error message if password has been changed.

fields.description: Since Jive 5.5.9, there has been a change in Jive's codebase which breaks Crowd integration.
fields.summary: Jive Forums 5.5.9 and above Support

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 31 October 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi everyone,
 
Thank you for your votes and comments on this improvement request. Whilst this is something we would like to eventually implement, it is not at the forefront of our upcoming roadmap plans.
 
We will be focussing on improving the integration of Crowd within our Atlassian suite of products, as well as simplifying and improving the overall user management and administrative experience.
 
If priorities change, this ticket will be updated. If you'd like to better understand how we make roadmap decisions, have a read of : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Implementation+of+New+Features+Policy
 
Cheers, 
Helen Hung
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

If a license is exceeded, users should no longer be able to log into Crowd-enabled apps but the Crowd admin should have the chance to fix the problem via Crowd Admin.

*Workaround:*

Please follow the instructions in [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWDKB/Users+are+Unable+to+Log+in+After+Updating+the+License].
fields.summary: Allow Crowd admin ability to adjust number of users if license is accidentally exceeded during configuration.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 November 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Dear all

The security of our products is crucial to us. We understand how essential features like 2FA are for you, our customers, especially in tools like Crowd. Therefore we would like to assure you that we're looking into exploring this feature for future versions of Crowd. However, at this point, we are not able to commit to aers, especially in tools like Crowd. Therefore we would like to assure you that we're looking into exploring this feature for future versions of Crny particular date. We are going to provide more updates on this ticket in CY21 Q2.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Marcin Kempa,
 Senior Development Team Lead, Crowd
 [mkempa@atlassian.com|mailto:mkempa@atlassian.com]
{panel}
Provide [two-factor authentication |http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-factor_authentication] in Crowd.
fields.summary: Support for two-factor authentication in Crowd.

fields.description:
During startup of 1.2.1 I get bunch of exception, mostly related to logging and not serious.  However this one is slightly more concerning:

20:45:55,088  INFO com.atlassian.crowd.startup: Starting Crowd, Version: 1.2.1 (Build:#192 - Dec 10, 2007) 
20:45:57,512  INFO integration.service.soap.client.GenericClient: Loading properties file crowd.properties from file:/opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/extranet-crowd/webapps/crowd/deployments/crowd-webapp-200712122039/WEB-INF/classes/crowd.properties
20:45:58,877 ERROR atlassian.crowd.manager.event.EventManagerGeneric: Event listener failed.
com.atlassian.crowd.event.EventJobExecutionException: Illegal address
        at com.atlassian.crowd.event.ResetPasswordEvent.execute(ResetPasswordEvent.java:186)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.event.EventManagerGeneric.processListeners(EventManagerGeneric.java:126)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.event.EventManagerGeneric.processEvents(EventManagerGeneric.java:65)
        at jrockit.reflect.VirtualNativeMethodInvoker.invoke(Ljava.lang.Object;[Ljava.lang.Object;)Ljava.lang.Object;(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Ljava.lang.Object;[Ljava.lang.Object;I)Ljava.lang.Object;(Unknown Source)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:296)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:177)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:144)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:107)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:166)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.HibernateInterceptor.invoke(HibernateInterceptor.java:104)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:166)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
        at $Proxy8.processEvents()V(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.event.EventProcessor.executeInternal(EventProcessor.java:32)
        at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
Caused by: javax.mail.internet.AddressException: Illegal address in string ``''
        at javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress.<init>(InternetAddress.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.event.ResetPasswordEvent.execute(ResetPasswordEvent.java:170)
        ... 17 more
fields.summary: Event listener exception during startup

fields.description:
On the search results pages remove the ""cache-control: no-store" directive.

* application browser
* principal browser
* group browser
* role browser
* session browser

See this article: http://blogs.atlassian.com/developer/2007/12/cachecontrol_nostore_considere.html
fields.summary: remove "cache-control: no-store" on search results pages

fields.description:
It's important to note that the jta jar will need to be deployed in the app server.

  http://java.sun.com/products/jta
fields.summary: Need to provide docs for WAR deployment of Crowd
